sentence.Network_cn: 屋顶上的雨水从一条漏水的管子中流出来.

phrase.cizu_name: up the spout Brit. informal 英，非正式

jx.jx_en_mean: no longer working or likely to be useful or successful
(of a bullet or cartridge) in the barrel of a gun and ready to be fired

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English (as a verb): from Middle Dutch spouten, from an imitative base shared by Old Norse spȳta 'to spit'

entry.def: If something spouts liquid or fire, or if liquid or fire spout out of something, it comes out very quickly with a lot of force.

example.ex: He replaced the boiler when the last one began to spout flames...
example.tran: 原来的锅炉开始往外喷火苗后他便换了个新的。

example.ex: The main square has a fountain that spouts water 40 feet into the air...
example.tran: 主广场有个喷泉，能将水喷射至 40 英尺高的空中。

entry.def: A spout of liquid is a long stream of it which is coming out of something very forcefully.

entry.tran: 喋喋不休地说;夸夸其谈
entry.def: If you say that a person spouts something, you disapprove of them because they say something which you do not agree with or which you think they do not honestly feel.

example.ex: He used his column to spout ill-informed criticism of the Scots rugby team.
example.tran: 他根本不了解苏格兰橄榄球队，却在自己的专栏上对其大加抨击。

example.ex: You're the kind of person who affiliates himself with the kind of crap they spout.
example.tran: 你这种人就会去附和他们的那些废话。

entry.def: A spout is a long, hollow part of a container through which liquids can be poured out easily.
If you say that something is up the spout, you mean that it is wrong or it is no longer working.

example.ex: If you only take a sample then all the statistics are up the spout.
example.tran: 如果你只采集了一个样本，那么所有的数据就有问题了。

means.word_mean: 1. an opening that allows the passage of liquids or grain
1. gush forth in a sudden stream or jet;
2. talk in a noisy, excited, or declamatory manner

auth_sentence.content: An iron ladle with a...spout opposite to the handle.

sentences.en: Blood was spouting from the deep cut in his arm.
sentences.cn: 血从他胳膊上深深的伤口里涌出来。

sentences.en: The broken pipe spouted water all over the room.
sentences.cn: 破裂的水管喷了一屋子的水。

means.word_mean: 滔滔不绝地讲；喋喋不休地说

sentences.cn: 讲师滔滔不绝地讲了几个小时。

sentences.en: He’s always spouting off about the behaviour of young people today.
sentences.cn: 他总是没完没了地数落如今年轻人的行为。

sentences.en: What are you spouting on about now?
Rain from the roof goes down a long spout.
sentences.cn: 屋顶上的雨水从一条漏水的管子中流出来。

means.word_mean: 在困难中；被毁灭；丧失掉

sentences.en: It looks like our holiday plans are up the spout.
sentences.cn: 看来我们的休假计划要泡汤了。

sentences.en: This information the bank sent me is totally up the spout.
sentences.cn: 银行发给我的信息完全不对。
